cards.name: Thran Quarry

rulings.text: Triggers at the end of every player’s turn.

cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no creatures, sacrifice Thran Quarry.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Serra Avatar

rulings.text: Whether or not the ability triggers depends on if the Avatar has the ability while in the graveyard. If it doesn’t (thanks to Yixlid Jailer, for instance), then the ability won’t trigger. It doesn’t matter whether the Avatar had the ability in its previous zone (it will trigger even if it had been on the battlefield with Humility).
Serra Avatar’s power and toughness are constantly updated as your life total changes.
The ability that defines Serra Avatar’s power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield.
If Serra Avatar is no longer in your graveyard when its triggered ability resolves, you won’t shuffle your library.

cards.text:
Serra Avatar's power and toughness are each equal to your life total.
When Serra Avatar is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.flavorText: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.
cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavorText: "Make me thy lyre, even as the forest is: What if my leaves are falling like its own!" - Percy Bysshe Shelley, "Ode to the West Wind"
cards.name: Elvish Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavorText: "Enter this palace-gate and ask the news Of greatness fallen into dust and clay." —The Arabian Nights, trans. Burton
cards.name: City of Brass

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass’s triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass’s ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.flavorText: Cast the weight as though it were a die, to see a rival's fate.
cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Two-Headed Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Two-Headed Dragon can block an additional creature each combat.
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavorText: The Sligh incubate in the Great Furnace's heat, emerging on Mirrodin's surface only when the four suns have aligned overhead.
cards.name: Slith Firewalker
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavorText: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
cards.name: Royal Assassin

rulings.text: Can’t target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin’s ability resolves, then the ability doesn’t resolve.

cards.flavorText: There were no tombstones in orochi territory. Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become part of the forest after death.
cards.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
cards.text: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Shard Phoenix

rulings.text: You can return Shard Phoenix any time during your upkeep; this is not a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.
Shard Phoenix uses Last Known Information. If, for example, it was blue when it was sacrificed, the damage will come from a blue source.

cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: It deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.flavorText: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."
cards.name: Soltari Priest
cards.text:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.flavorText: Amid this whirling hurricane of blades, there is no calm eye in which the hapless can find shelter.
cards.name: Whirling Dervish

rulings.text: If it damages the opponent multiple times in a turn, it gets only one +1/+1 counter at end of turn.

cards.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavorText: The songs of angels are perceived not as words in the ears but as stirrings in the soul.
cards.name: Glorious Anthem

cards.flavorText: "We've endured your slights to Gaea with the grace of tolerance. Now behold the grace of our ferocity."
cards.name: Elvish Champion

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavorText: One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.
cards.name: Mad Auntie

rulings.text: The second ability can target any Goblin permanent except the Mad Auntie whose ability is being activated. It can target a different Mad Auntie.

cards.text:
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Regenerate another target Goblin.
